kou commented on pull request #3377: KSZUCS/ARROW-4233: [Packaging] Use Docker to build source archive 
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3377#discussion_r247301484
 
 

 ##########
 File path: dev/release/02-source.sh
 ##########
 @@ -43,52 +43,15 @@ fi
 
 echo "Using commit $release_hash"
 
-tarball=${tag}.tar.gz
+tarball=$SOURCE_DIR/${tag}.tar.gz
 
-extract_dir=tmp-apache-arrow
-rm -rf ${extract_dir}
-# be conservative and use the release hash, even though git produces the same
-# archive (identical hashes) using the scm tag
-git archive ${release_hash} --prefix ${extract_dir}/ | tar xf -
+# won't be required after removing docker-compose from the dev directory
+docker_compose_yml=$SOURCE_DIR/../../docker-compose.yml
 
 Review comment:
   I think that using our docker-compose system is better than I did in #3376!
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.

fields.description:
[https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3375]
It's better that we maintain a Dockerfile than maintaining a shell script for Linux and macOS.
fields.summary: [Packaging] Create a Dockerfile to build source archive
